title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must state that both the consumer surplus will decrease to zero and explain why in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the consumer surplus will decrease to zero and/or does not explain that the consumer surplus for the single-price monopolist is the area below the demand curve and above the price. Since the perfectly price-discriminating monopolist will charge the price set by the demand curve for every quantity of output, there will be no consumer surplus.

The response states that the consumer surplus will decrease to zero and explains that the consumer surplus for the single-price monopolist is the area below the demand curve and above the price. Since the perfectly price-discriminating monopolist will charge the price set by the demand curve for every quantity of output, there will be no consumer surplus.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must state that both the perfectly price-discriminating monopolist is allocatively efficient and explain why in order to receive the point.
